Today we're announcing the expansion of our virtual program to include students in grades K through 12. We successfully launched our virtual high school last fall and ended the year with ninety students. By expanding this opportunity to include elementary and middle school students, we aim to provide families looking for a more flexible learning environment with the same high-quality instruction they have come to expect from Bay City teachers.

This expansion of virtual education will occur alongside the district’s plan for returning to in-person instruction in the fall. Today’s news that Governor Whitmer is also planning for students’ return to schools is encouraging. Based on her direction, we will be working with district and community leaders throughout the summer to prepare for students' safe return to our buildings in the fall. By providing a virtual option as well, we are planning to meet a variety of needs for families and students.

To learn more, and to sign up for updates, visit our informational landing page about new K-12 virtual school options at bcschools.online.

March 12, 2020

Dear Bay City Public Schools Community:

Governor Whitmer announced recommended community mitigation strategies for local school districts on March 11, 2020. We are maximizing our efforts to assist in slowing the spread of the COVID-19 virus.

Effective immediately, Bay City Public Schools is canceling all non-essential large gatherings for the months of March and April, except for Michigan High School Athletic Association (MHSAA) events. We expect MHSAA to come out with guidelines shortly (which will be followed). Examples of canceled events include but are not limited to the following:

• School field trips
• Assemblies
• Concerts
• Parent Teacher Conferences
• Dances
• Pep Rallies
• Team spring training trips
• Class trips
• Elementary and Middle School athletics
• Community gatherings / facility use of our buildings

We appreciate your patience, flexibility and support during this unprecedented time. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact your building principal or reach out to us at info@bcschools.net.

Sincerely,

Dr. Stephen C. Bigelow
Superintendent

Special Shout Out to Rebecca Field, Sandy Stevens, and Jennifer Jungnitsch for receiving a grant from the 2019 DOW Corning Foundation/SVSU-Community STEM Partnership!

HEMLOCK, Mich. — When Kolb and McAlear-Sawden elementary schools in Bay City won a CARE Grant recently from Hemlock Semiconductor Operations (HSC), it meant a whole new learning opportunity for the more than 1,000 students.

The money will help the schools purchase nonfiction reading materials intended to get K-5 students excited about science, technology, engineering and math (STEM). The schools also will be able to buy STEM kits that will give hands-on experience with these subjects to all students, including those in special education or learning to speak English.

“We’re so excited by this opportunity to buy these materials for our students, and to give our teachers new ways to engage their classes on these important topics,” said Bay City Public Schools Superintendent Steve Bigelow. “HSC’s support could spark a lifelong love for math and science in our elementary students.”

The Board of Education has authorized a $28.4 million bond proposal (zero millage increase - no increase in taxes from the millage) for Tuesday, May 5, 2020. We are focusing on facility and building enhancements, technology updates, and school bus replacement.

What physical improvements would you like to see in our district? You may target your suggestions to any one of our 18 buildings or the district as a whole. Please take a few moments to share your thoughts on our Thought Exchange platform. Please star at least 20 thoughts: one star is the lowest rating, while 5 is the highest. This exchange will be kept open until 4 PM on Monday, November 4, 2019.

https://my.thoughtexchange.com/#349804178

You remain confidential through this entire process. Thank you for helping us shape a bright future!

Sincerely,
Dr. Bigelow

This week, thanks to SVSU, we began a partnership with students and staff from Kittur, India. Our new friends spent two days at Central and two days at Western High School this week. Beth Ann Fall, a French teacher at Western High School, rekindled the BCPS French American Student Exchange Program. We are paired with Evry-Courcouronnes, France (a suburb of Paris). Susan Elder, a German teacher at Central, is in the process of developing a program with partners in Germany. We are worldwide! #BCPS
